title: Big data projects may fail to deliver business value, cautions Gartner
text: #analytics Big data projects may fail to deliver business value, cautions Gartner By 2018, 50 percent of business ethics violations will occur through improper use of big data analytics. 12 October 2015, 10:41 AM IST By Ashwani Mishra We are awash in a flood of data today. In a broad range of application areas, data is being collected at unprecedented scale.The use of big data growing datasets with sizes beyond the ability of conventional database tools to store, manage, and analyze them has time and again been said to become the basis of competition and growth for businesses, enhancing productivity, cost reduction, and creating significant value by reducing waste and increasing the quality of products and services.However, a recent study from Gartner cautions that analytics projects that utilize big data or advanced analytics present a heightened risk of failure. The research firm also predicts that, by 2018, 50 percent of business ethics violations will occur through improper use of big data analytics."Although big data and advanced analytics are increasingly popular projects, they risk many of the same pitfalls as traditional projects, in most cases; these risks are accentuated due to the volume and variety of data, or the sophistication of advanced analytics capabilities. Most pitfalls will not result in an obvious technical or analytic failure. Rather they will result in a failure to deliver business value," Gartner said.Failure to properly understand and mitigate the risks can have a number of unintended and highly impactful consequences. Those can include loss of reputation, limitations in business operations, losing out to competitors, inefficient or wasted use of resources, and even legal sanctions.To read the detailed analysis, click here .
